message.content: This question requires an understanding of heat transfer and thermodynamics. When two objects are in contact, heat will transfer from the object with higher temperature to the object with lower temperature until they reach thermal equilibrium. In this case, the hot tea has a higher temperature than the iced tea. Therefore, heat will transfer from the hot tea to the iced tea, causing the hot tea to become colder and the iced tea to become warmer. Option (A) is incorrect because it is unrelated to the question. Option (C) is incorrect because the iced tea will become warmer, not colder. Option (D) is unrelated to the question and is a play on words.

This question requires some understanding of thermodynamics and heat transfer. When a hot cup of tea is placed next to a glass of iced tea, heat will transfer from the hot tea to the surrounding environment, including the iced tea. This means that the hot tea will lose heat and become colder over time. Option (A) is unrelated to the question and is incorrect. Option (C) is also incorrect because the iced tea will gain heat from the hot tea and become warmer, not colder. Option (D) is a play on words and not related to the question.

This question requires an understanding of basic thermodynamics. When a cup of hot tea is placed next to a glass of iced tea, heat energy will transfer from the hot tea to the iced tea, causing the hot tea to become colder. This is because heat always flows from a higher temperature to a lower temperature. Option (A) is unrelated to the question and is incorrect. Option (C) is the opposite of what happens - the iced tea will actually become warmer. Option (D) is a play on words and does not provide a relevant answer.
